title: The book that sank on the Titanic and burned in the Blitz
description: A jewel-encrusted book sank on RMS Titanic on 15 April 1912 - but this was not the end of the story.

title: Africa's week in pictures: 8-14 April 2022
description: A selection of the best photos from across Africa and beyond this week.

title: Sienna Miller: Anatomy of a Scandal actress on the 'ignorance' of privilege
description: The actress says she's angered by those who "don't think" about the struggles of ordinary people.

title: Durban floods: Is it a consequence of climate change?
description: KwaZulu-Natal province has seen some serious flooding, but there isn't one clear explanation.

title: Jerusalem on edge as festivals fall amid tensions
description: Ramadan, Passover and Easter are being marked at a time of growing Israeli-Palestinian bloodshed.

title: Brazil: Wild animals take to the streets in Rio de Janeiro
description: Videos of caimans and other wild animals in streets and houses are frequently surfacing in the city.

title: Shanghai lockdown: How angry netizens test China's 'Great Firewall'
description: Videos appearing to show people suffering in Shanghai's lockdown have gone viral, stretching censors.

title: Ukraine: Returning home to a country still at war
description: Despite the war continuing, some Ukrainians are now going back to their homeland.

title: 'I'm shocked by my church leaders in Moscow' - priest in Ukraine
description: The Russian Orthodox Church's war stance has prompted some Ukrainian priests and parishioners to cut ties.

title: Ukraine's battle for control of its skies
description: A Ukrainian air defence officer tells the BBC: "Whoever dominates the air wins the war."

title: Behind the scenes in Zelensky's modern HQ
description: Clive Myrie visits the heavily fortified Situation Room - the HQ of the resistance against Russia's invasion.

title: Both my girls have Crohn's and it's heart-breaking
description: Sisters Kirstie and Abbie Gray both have bowel disease but it affects them in very different ways.

title: Operation Mincemeat: The Welsh drifter who helped end WW2
description: A new film tells the story of a homeless man from south Wales whose body was used to deceive the Germans.

title: Depp and Heard marriage ended in 'mutual abuse', says therapist
description: A psychotherapist tells the court of a volatile dynamic between the couple during therapy sessions.

title: Ukraine round up: Flagship Russian warship sinks
description: Russia's flagship Black Sea missile cruiser has sunk, while President Zelensky sits down with the BBC.

description: Russian sources claim Aiden Aslin has been captured in the besieged city of Mariupol.

title: 'I won't give them hate' - brother of British victim of Islamic State
description: Relatives remember their lost loved ones as a jihadist is found guilty of conspiring to murder hostages in Syria.

title: Southend Council to mow parks and grass once a year
description: The council says it will encourage biodiversity and help it achieve net-zero carbon emissions.

title: Quiz of the week: Why is Richard Osman leaving Pointless?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: UK asylum deal: Is Rwanda a land of safety or fear?
description: Visitors to Rwanda are often impressed by its efficiency, but should be careful what they say.

title: Ukraine's President Zelensky to BBC: Blood money being paid for Russian oil
description: Ukraine's leader tells the BBC that all European countries should have ended Russian energy imports.

title: Local elections: 'I honestly don't have a clue'
description: As voter registration closes for the local elections, how much do young Londoners care?

title: Elon Musk makes offer to buy Twitter

title: PM vows to set record straight over claims he misled MPs over parties
description: Boris Johnson vows to "set the record straight" over claims he lied to Parliament over Partygate.

title: Covid levels starting to fall in UK, says ONS
description: About one in 15 people would test positive for coronavirus, as levels start to fall.

title: UK to give asylum seekers one-way ticket to Rwanda
description: Some asylum seekers who arrive on small boats will be sent to the country as part of a £120m trial.

title: Blackpool Zoo's 'irreplaceable' giant tortoise dies aged 105
description: Darwin the Aldabra tortoise had been a popular attraction at Blackpool Zoo since its opening in 1972.

title: Germany kidnap plot: Gang planned to overthrow democracy
description: A gang with links to far-right and anti-Covid groups wanted to overthrow democracy, say prosecutors.

title: Queen not expected to attend Easter Sunday service
description: Buckingham Palace indicates the Queen will miss the service at St George's Chapel in Windsor Castle.

title: World Snooker Championship: Holder Mark Selby drawn against Jamie Jones in first round
description: Defending champion Mark Selby will face Wales' Jamie Jones in the first round of the World Championship.

title: Ted Hankey: Former darts champion admits sexual assault
description: The 54-year-old, nicknamed The Count, won the BDO World Championship in 2000 and 2009.

title: Anya Shrubsole: England bowler and World Cup winner retires from international game
description: England bowler Anya Shrubsole, a key part of England's 2017 World Cup triumph, retires from the international game.

title: Cuba Gooding Jr: Actor admits forcibly kissing waitress
description: The Oscar-winning star strikes a plea deal to bring criminal proceedings against him to an end.

title: Tiger Woods: 15-time major winner to play JP McManus Pro-Am at Adare Manor in July
description: Fifteen-time major winner Tiger Woods is added to a star-studded field for the JP McManus Pro-Am at Adare Manor in July.

title: NFT of Jack Dorsey's first tweet struggles to sell
description: Malaysia-based Sina Estavi has been offered just a small fraction of the $2.9m he paid for the tweet.

title: Valneva Covid vaccine approved for use in UK
description: The Valneva jab is manufactured using technology similar to how flu shots are made.

title: Freddy Rincon: Former Colombia captain dies following car crash

description: The shooting of an apparently unarmed black man on 4 April in Michigan has led to protests.

title: Genetic testing: Babies with rare illnesses given hope

title: Ukraine war: Farmers stretched to the brink in Odesa

title: Bollywood wishes Ranbir and Alia well as they marry

title: The Papers: 'Worst to come for PM' and Rwanda to take UK migrants
description: Reports that Boris Johnson could face more fines over Partygate and plans for Channel migrants to be processed in Rwanda lead the papers.

title: Doctor Who: 'I wanted The Doctor to whisk me away from everything awful'
description: A new Timelord audio series starts this weekend - written by and starring transgender women.

title: Police arrest suspect in New York subway shooting 'without incident'
description: "We got him," says New York mayor following massive manhunt in wake of the Brooklyn subway shooting.
